expanded_queries: Configuration parameters for automated literature retrieval agents
Best practices for research scoping tool configuration
Optimizing max_papers limits in RAG pipelines
Time-based filtering strategies for scientific search 2020-2026
Performance analysis of live vs cached academic retrieval mode
Impact of cache_ttl settings on research reproducibility
Recent developments in metadata search limits 2020 onwards
Standardized run directories for research software outputs
Designing efficient LLM literature review architectures
Debug logging and raw LLM output storage standards
Trade-offs in real-time academic literature fetching
target_subtasks: Identify industry standards for configuring research retrieval systems (e.g., max_papers, min_year).
Analyze the operational cost and latency of 'live' retrieval modes versus cached methods.
Evaluate the necessity and security implications of storing raw LLM outputs for debugging.
Survey literature on optimal cache Time-To-Live (TTL) settings for rapid knowledge domains.
Examine trends in automated systematic review tools published between 2020 and 2026.
Determine best practices for structuring and managing 'runs' directories in reproducible research projects.
Investigate the role of parameter limits (like 80 papers) in controlling hallucination and focus.
notes: The search focuses on the architecture and configuration parameters of automated research scoping agents and RAG systems, prioritizing literature from the past few years (2020+). Efficiency, reproducibility, and parameter tuning are key areas.
